name: The Honorable Norman Ackerman
assigned: PA - Philadelphia County Court of Common Pleas
bio:
The Hon. Norman Ackerman (Ret.) served as a judge for the Philadelphia County Court of Common Pleas in Pennsylvania. Ackerman was appointed to the bench by former Governor Bob Casey in 1988. He retired in 2005 and continued to preside as a senior judge until 2013.

Prior to his appointment, Ackerman worked as an attorney in private practice. He also served as a deputy city commissioner for the City of Philadelphia (1980 to 1988), a deputy state attorney for the Pennsylvania Office of the Attorney General, and a trustee for the United States Bankruptcy Court.

Ackerman earned a B.S. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1957. He then completed a J.D. at Temple University, James E. Beasley School of Law in 1960.

His memberships have included the Pennsylvania Bar Association, the Philadelphia Bar Association, and the Pennsylvania Task Force on Drug Handling.
